snippet: After weathering the first two years of Europe’s economic crisis fairly well, some companies in the United States are warning investors that their sales on the Continent are slowing down.
abstract: Growing number of companies in the United States are warning investors that sales in Europe are slowing and could get worse; market watchers were optimistic that the American economy had decoupled from Europe's, but that assessment appears to have changed; most of the focus has been on oppressive debt and debilitated banks in the euro zone, but concerns are shifting to the drag that Europe is exerting on the global economy.
lead_paragraph: After weathering the first two years of Europe’s economic crisis fairly well, some companies in the United States are warning investors that their sales on the Continent are slowing down.

headline.seo: U.S. Companies Warn of Slowing Sales in Europe
headline.main: Europe’s Fade Becomes Drag on Sales for U.S. Companies
headline.print_headline: Europe’s Fade Becoming a Drag on U.S. Sales
